titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Luther Noss Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 07:44

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: Diaries, correspondence, subject files, photographs, publications, and printed material documenting the personal and professional lives of Luther Noss.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of the Estate of Osea Noss, 2005; transfer from the Irving S. Gilmore Music Library, 2012-2013.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has been transferred to Yale University for unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator(s) of this collection. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Luther Noss Papers (MS 1853). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Luther Melancthon Noss was born on July 21, 1907, in Leland, Illinois. He was educated at Northwestern University (B. Mus., 1930) and Yale University (B. Mus., 1931, M. Mus., 1932). He served as a combat intelligence specialist with the 73rd Bombardment Wing during World War II, based in Saipan. He was assistant professor of music at Cornell University from 1935-1939; thereafter he spent the rest of his career at Yale University. He served as professor of music, chair of the department of music, dean of the school of music, director of the university choir, and master of Silliman College. He edited several hymnals and authored two books on the Yale School of Music and Paul Hindemith. In 1936 he married Osea Calciolari. Luther Noss died on February 9, 1995.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Diaries, correspondence, subject files, photographs, publications, sheet music, and other printed material documenting the personal and professional lives of Luther Noss.

did.unittitle: Personal effects [includes desk items, jewelry, inkwell]
Personal effects [includes desk items, jewelry, inkwell]
Typed transcriptions of journals from 1927 to 1966
Yale University: course outlines for Choir Music and Liturgical Music
Noss family history and related materials
Research files on church history, liturgy
Yale University: School of Music, Silliman College
Books about Yale and School of Music

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials in this accession are arranged according to document type. Correspondence is arranged alphabetically according to correspondent. Sheet music is arranged alphabetically according to the title of the composition.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This accession comprises concert programs; correspondence primarily pertaining to the publication of the book, Christian Hymns , edited by Luther Noss; research notes pertaining to Christian Hymns and to Noss's study of classical and liturgical music; papers written by Noss while a student at Northwestern University; and unpublished sheet music for compositions either written or arranged by Noss while a student at Northwestern University and the Yale School of Music, and as a professor at Cornell University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This accession consists of office files from the 1970s related to Luther Noss' career as a professor at the Yale School of Music, as well as correspondence and subject files pertaining to the writing and publication of his book, Paul Hindemith in the United States .

unittitle.title: Paul Hindemith in the United States

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This accession consists primarily of correspondence concerning Luther Noss's professional service and publications.
